alert.note: Alert for Butler; Greenwood (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 14 at 4:23PM CDT until July 14 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wichita has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Butler County in south central Kansas... Greenwood County in southeastern Kansas... * Until 500 PM CDT. * At 423 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Cottonwood Falls to 14 miles west of Hamilton to 14 miles northeast of Leon, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Eureka, Madison, Hamilton, Virgil, Eureka City Lake, Eureka Airport and Thrall. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
